comment: very particular about essay,You can only miss three days until it affects your grade, and does NOT care if it's a medical reason or family emergency, and have to put on a performance at the end on stage not as fun as it sounds/lots if team work.

Responds to emails pretty quickly. Doesn't grade harshly. Textbook wasn't really needed. The class can get expensive b/c you're required to see 2 school plays and 1 professional out of school play. Only allowed 2 unexcused absences. Pretty chill.
rating_tags: Group projects--So many papers--Accessible outside class

comment: He makes you attend two school plays and one professional play which can be expensive and inconvenient. He makes you write 2-page essays for each play and is a tough grader. He can be lenient one day, then strict the next. You can only miss three days until it affects your grade, and does NOT care if it's a medical reason or family emergency.

I'M GONNA MISS TAKING THIS PROFESSOR SO MUCH :(((!!! this is the best professor i've ever had at ksu, he's literally the sweetest, easy to talk to, and responds to emails fast. you ARE required to see performances and write a response paper for each, but he gives you 3 months to submit them all. attendance is a big portion of your grade so show up
super strict on attendance, like you can't even be sick. However, it was an easy class as long as you don't miss any days.

I'm not into theatre but I took this class and really enjoyed it because of Dean. His energy is great and he really knows a lot about theatre and is very passionate. He can get serious at times but only really when it was necessary, and he would quickly get back to the light-hearted side. Overall a great choice for this class

He was by far my favorite instructor; he kept the class respectful and had the best energy the whole year. I really enjoyed the content of this course, it was engaging and diverse and I noticed that my classmates of different backgrounds were all interested. The textbook is "required", but I didn't open it once, although you will need the plays.

Coutris cultivates a learning environment where all feel comfortable in participating in discussions. I learned a lot about theatre, people, and society. The class covers an overview of theatre history and movements. Assignments include studying scripts, understanding theatre application, and learning about local theatres. An entertaining class!

He was a great teacher who truly loves theatre. I am not someone who loves theatre or the arts but I enjoyed this. We had a few group projects and response papers to productions outside of class but other than that it was participation heavy. He really cares about the class and has you act out many different parts even if you arent experienced.
